fields.description:
Hello,

After the server restarts, some plans don't wake up. 
Even if we try to manually run build, they do not start.

In the home page, those plans are marked with the source update icon.
In the plan Activity tab, we can see the message below
{code}
No activity logged for this plan.
{code}

fields.description:
Hello,

We have defined a plan with "Script" as builder and added some extra custom requirements.
Each time we modify the Builder configuration,  all the requirements are erased except the "Script" one.

Apparently, this does not happen with the other kinds of builder.
fields.summary: Requirements are erased if builder configuration has changed

fields.description:
've just switched from M6 to M7. I've spotted a problem that somehow M7 (compared to M6) seems too eagerly mark remote agents as "offline" and in result it shuts them down - about 5-10 per 4-5 hours. I've logged in to each of "offline" instances before they went down, but in elastic agent's logs there was nothing suspicious and it seems it was connecting fine with SSH tunnelled connection back to the master.
Do you know if any additional functionality (apart from official fix for-s for M7 - [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM/fixforversion/14643]) were added so that they can introduce this kind of behaviour - compared to M6? I've noticed that if the elastic agent is marked as "offline" it happens just after a build is completed on this agent (of course it doesn't happen after every completed build).
Nothing weird happened in Bamboo master's logs and the only sign of the node being put down is simply:

fields.description:
When Bamboo builds our projects that use TestNG and have tests that use TestNG's @DataProvider to run the same test with multiple parameters, Bamboo counts them as a single test. For example, Bamboo says our current project has only 44 tests, but running the test goal in Maven shows we have 60 tests. For another project that makes extensive use of DataProviders, this discrepancy is much higher. Bamboo shows 38 tests while Maven reports 241.

Best regards,
Arthur Kalmenson
fields.summary: TestNG tests with DataProviders not counted correctly

fields.description:
My use case is starting my elastic instances in the morning and shutting down in the evening because my load requirements follow that pattern. Theoretically BAM-3078 and BAM-3077 will achieve this.

I can script the starting up and shutting down of my instances today, but experimentation has shown that the EBS volume creation and mounting is not reliable, especially when multiple instances are started at once. I can ssh into the instances and see if the ebs volume was mounted, but I need the IP address of the machine first.

Currently the REST API can't help me since it returns only this sort of thing:

{code}
<response>

fields.description:
The following has been observed: The EA does not start up if shell scripts fail to run successfully. So far this has happened in h4. {{/opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/restoreSnapshot.sh}} and {{/opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/setAwsEnv.sh}} can be failing on getting the *availability zone* using curl. This is stopping the agent from starting successfully. The response from amazon is {code} 404 - Not Found

404 - Not Found

{code} and the agent is not started up. The instance remains idle - no warning or error messages are sent to the server. then restoreSnapshot.sh hangs {code} 1 0 1122 1114 23 0 2648 484 wait S ? 0:00 /bin/sh /opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/restoreSnapshot.sh 0 0 1123 1122 24 0 2640 1136 wait S ? 0:00 bash /usr/local/ec2/ec2-api-tools/bin/ec2-create-volume --snapshot snap-d64885bf --availability-zone {code}

fields.description:
In the build configuration, the Source Repository tab displays a list of Externals Paths & Revisions.

This is information is stored in the database column: BUILD_DEFINITION.XML_DEFINITION_DATA;  in the following xpath:  /configuration/repository/svn/externalsToRevisionMappings.

When the svn:externals on the repository changes, new entries are added to this list;  but old entries are not removed.  So the list ends up showing more externals than are actually used.
Luckily, the 'Detect changes in externals option' correctly detects only changes in the actual externals used, and not any of the superfluous entries.

You should be able to look at the Source Repository tab and see an accurate list of externals.

To replicate:

1) Configure a repository URL with the following svn:externals property:

TestA     https://<path to some repository location>
TestB     https://<path to some other repository location>

2) Create a build plan pointing at this URL.   After saving, check the Source Repository tab (you should see "TestA" and "TestB" listed in the externals).

3) Reconfigure the URL with the following svn:externals property:

TestA     https://<path to some repository location>
TestC     https://<path to a third repository location>

4) Edit & resave the build plan, re-run the build etc..   The Source Repository tab will now list "TestA", "TestB" and "TestC"  (even though TestB is not longer referenced anywhere).
fields.summary: externalsToRevisionMappings entries not removed

fields.description:
I've attempted to modify the location of the log4j file for a bamboo agent, but without success.
- According to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Logging+in+Bamboo, this can be done by adding an environment variable log4j.configuration or log4j.appender.fileLog.file. I've tried these with -D command line arguments, unix shell exports, inclusion in the bamboo-agent.cfg file and even as an agent capability. Although no approach actually works properly, the -D approach is the most successful. It starts out with the agent log in the correct place but then indicates that it's launching a remote agent, after which the output is generated into an atlassian-bamboo.log file in the root. I think the agent is launching a new process and forgetting to pass on environment variables.

Two comments about the aforementioned documentation link: 
- It omits to specify that the /path/to/log4j.properties value should be specified as a url (ie file:///path/to/log4j.properies). 
- It specifies that this data can be aded to the bamboo-agent.cfg file but omits to specify how and where in the file this should be done.
fields.summary: agent execution generates atlassian-bamboo.log file regardless of configuration

fields.summary: Specifying build requirements when setting up a new plan explodes
Bamboo is still reporting false positives with SUCCESS_MESSAGE_LINES = 3000

fields.description: In order for trusted apps to be supported, bouncy castle (the crypto library trusted apps uses) needs to be installed in the WEB/lib folder of Bamboo, because this library is signed, and hence can't be deployed to an Atlassian plugins container because Atlassian plugins will make changes to the jar that breaks the signature.  The installation of this library can be made a part of the installation process for the trusted apps plugin, however, in order for the plugin to be able to use it, it needs to exported into the OSGi container by Bamboo.  This change is to make Bamboo export it, if it exists.
fields.summary: Support trusted apps plugin

fields.description: I recently noticed that, while I have gzip compression enabled in my bamboo settings and most pages are gzip'd, the full build logs are not. As our logs are very large, this would be a huge improvement to our performance.
fields.summary: Full build log is not requested with gzip encoding even if gzip compression enabled in bamboo

fields.description:
I wish there was some build / queue / agent management that would allow me to ....

1.  Pause (hold)  items on the build queue
2. Change the order of items in the queue

3.  Assign a given plan or even an entire project to a particular agent

4. Have a build be able to started immediatly w/o regards to the queue or available agent.
fields.summary: Build Management

fields.description:
After disabling the plan can it be possible not to show in the home page. just want to archive the disabled build and delete after some configured time.
There should be a folder with 'Disabled Plans' at the bottom (probably)
fields.summary: Disabled plans should disappear from the home page and should be deleted (with warning) after a preconfigured time
Fix the double OAuth issue

fields.description:
An administrator can select a dependency blocking strategy for a build plan, (on the Dependencies tab when editing a build), even if the build plan has no parent build.

This is redundant and potentially misleading. The UI should either prevent a blocking strategy from being selected unless a parent build is selected or have some sort of validation on the 'Save' button to prevent this from happening.
fields.summary: An admin can select a dependency blocking strategy for a build even if the build has no parent builds

fields.description:
REST plugins that provide web interfaces may want to be decorated using the {{<meta>}} decorator tags. In order for this to be followed, {{/rest/*}} urls need to go through sitemesh.

The same behaviour has already been applied to Jira (JRA-17182) and Confluence (CONF-15561)
fields.summary: Allow REST plugins to be decorated

fields.description:
Studio needs a plugin point that will allow it to override certain sitemesh decorators, specifically, the admin decorator, so that the Bamboo admin screens can be included in the JIRA Studio global admin screens.  This plugin point has been implemented into JIRA like so:

https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/jira?cs=78027
fields.summary: Pluggable sitemesh decorators

fields.description:
A plugin point is needed by JIRA Studio to provide its own top navigation and footer HTML fragments.  This plugin should mimic JIRAs plugin points, which when used look like this:

https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-jira-plugin/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml?r=37119#l123
fields.summary: Pluggable top navigation and footers

fields.description:
SVN / SVNkit is giving us much grief. Often the statement of a customer is bamboo does not work but the native command line client works.

to help debugging svn repository problems support needs a java svn command line client that uses the svnkit.jar

fisheye has a similar solution called jsvn. Adoption for bamboo should be a breeze.
fields.summary: Add svnkit java command line client to bamboo distribution to analyse svn problems

fields.description:
I am using getRecentlyCompletedBuildResultsForBuild to get the latest successful build to release -but if the build is older than (days, weeks?) - then the response is empty.
How else is one supposed to get the latest successful build ?
fields.summary: /api/rest/getRecentlyCompletedBuildResultsForBuild.action gives empty output

fields.summary: Server does not receive build results after remote agent finished the build - build is assumed active

fields.description:
The bamboo clover plugin, needs access to all of clovers history points before generating a clover history report.
If the build is run on a different agent than it was previously, then not all Clover history points will be available. 

The plugin needs a way to:
* access a directory of files, that were generated by previous builds.
* specify that an artifact must be made available to subsequent builds.

One way, although not ideal, would be to store such artifacts in a {{.bamboo}} directory on the agent, in the plan's build-dir. 
The agent would then retrieve any PLAN level artifacts and store them there, prior to starting the build. 
* Artifacts could be retrieved via HTTP, from the bamboo server.
* At the end of the build, the .bamboo directory is zipped, and sent back to the server and stored as a PLAN level artifact.
* The location of the .bamboo directory would need to be made available to any build plugins via a property, so that it can be passed to the actual build.

I believe this would also be useful for passing other artifacts between builds, such as an application.war from one build, to other dependent builds that then test that war.
fields.summary: Allow artifacts to be passed from Server to Agent

fields.description:
Key areas of focus:

# Automatically track and link through to Clovers HTML reports
# 'One-click' clover integration into Ant and Maven2 builds
# Improved support for Clover in a mult-agent build environment
# exposing Clover's line level coverage data via a REST api
# host Clover gadgets to allow other applications to embed Clover data
fields.summary: Improve Clover-Bamboo Plugin

fields.description:
Add a new artifact type that gets stored with each plan, not just each build of a plan.

This is needed for the bamboo-clover-plugin, so it can access all history points across all builds for a specific plan.

As with build artifacts, plan artifacts would need to expire certain files that are older than a specified time/build number.
fields.summary: Provide Plan level artifacts in Bamboo

fields.description:
To allow Clover 'one-click' integration of bamboo builds, the bamboo-clover plugin needs to do the following:

h3. Ant
Append configuration of the form {{-lib clover.jar -Dclover.option=option ...}} to the Ant Builder command line.
See also: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOV-431

h3. Maven
Append:
{{clover2:instrument clover2:aggregate clover2:clover}}
to the command line.

h3. Set and Collect Clover build artifacts.
The following system artifacts need to then be configured by the plugin:
* clover.xml
* clover/html
* clover.snapshot (plan level)
* clover-history.tar.gz (plan level)
fields.summary: Provide a plugin point to decorate the builder command line

fields.description:
To avoid the need for a user to configure the location of the clover.xml (and the clover HTML too), allow a new mechanism for storing build artifacts that are available to the 'system' only. ie users should not be able to edit, add or remove them.

The proposed 'one-click' Clover integration option, would use this feature so a user can simply check a checkbox to have code coverage reported for their build, without a user having to specify its location.
fields.summary: Provide means to store 'system artifacts' - that can be configured by plugins

fields.description: Queue reordering should be dynamicly driven on the clientside (Drag and Drop). Currently we use Up and Down arrows to achieve the reordering.
fields.summary: Queue reordering should be dynamicly driven on the clientside (Drag and Drop)

fields.description:
If a remote agent goes offline while the server is importing.  It then tries to write the information to the db.   However we can not guarantee what state the database is in or what data it might be updating.   

This monitoring stuff should be frozen for imports.
fields.summary: Remote Agent Monitoring Could Cause data corruption during import

fields.description:
Not sure if this is a bug or if there was a design choice behind this but..

Windows seems to only have two options when running the remote agent through the installer. 
1. Run it in console mode
2. Run it as a service.  
The start and stop commands will also start the service.
fields.summary: Windows can't start agent as a background process

fields.description:
When you start a remote agent on windows the installer starts up, wrapper starts and the agents starts all in console mode(all good so far).  The problem is there is no way to effectively kill it.  
When entering ctrl-c the installer process is brought down, but either the wrapper is still alive OR the wrapper restarts itself.  So you have to actually go in and kill the process off to stop the agent.
fields.summary: Killing remote agent installer on window results in rogue processes

fields.description:
See here for what we are talking about - http://developer.amazonwebservices.com/connect/entry.jspa?externalID=1347

Availability zone support is a pre-requisite for [Reserved Instance|http://aws.amazon.com/ec2/faqs/#What_is_a_Reserved_Instance] support.

We should have a default availability zone (for the Bamboo install) and be able to specify the avail zone per Elastic Configuration.
fields.summary: Add support for EC2 Availability Zones

fields.description:
An external database can be accessed from many bamboo instances. Naturally the DB schema will be updated when an upgrade occurred.
However an older instance of bamboo (with a different bamboo.home) may access the DB accidentally. A tag with the bamboo revision build number should protect the database from being accessed by older versions of bamboo.

>> ERROR : FATAL : This version of bamboo cannot access the database compatible to bamboo version xxx
fields.summary: Bamboo database instance should be tagged with the bamboo revision build number to avoid version conflicts between  db schema and bamboo.cfg.xml
In bamboo.sh *Bamboo.bat JAVA_HOME is not used to start bamboo

fields.description: Svnkit 1.3 was released on 13 May 2009.  FishEye are upgrading to it.  Let's watch and if successful let's do the same.
fields.summary: Upgrade svnkit to 1.3

fields.description:
As per Krystian's comments - http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-3766?focusedCommentId=160191&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_160191 we want to make it possible for a customer to follow instructions/install software so that an instances of an AMI can be spawned by Bamboo server and have elastic agents start up on them.

This is will get us out of the endless cycle of upgrading the default AMI.
fields.summary: Make it possible (via instructions) for a customer to 'Bamboo enable' an AMI
Make it all work with the new ElasticConfiguration concept
Remove old reload default capabilities stuff (maybe turn it into revert to defaults)?
Prevent Capabilities from being overwritten at startup
Generalise the Edit Capability Screen
Set up work flow (actions etc) for elastic capability editing

fields.description:
If a build failed to finish it doesn't error out, it just *disappears*. This is a source of confusion among the users. They see that the "Running" icon is gone and automatically assume that the "Build Link" is the result of their build.

Any attempted build should have a result for example
Agent '007.bond.com' went offline while building GOLD-FINGER-259. The build results will not be saved.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-1864
fields.summary: Keep build result of incomplete builds and mark them as failed and give the reason of failure where possible

fields.description: We use disabled builds as templates for other builds.  We noticed that it was polling for source updates even though the build was disabled.  I don't know what the overhead of this is but there doesn't seem any way to stop this behavior other than deleting the build plans.  Bamboo shouldn't poll for source updates on disabled builds.

It looks like when we updated svn kit to 1.2.1 the jna library was not updated correctly.  We should be using 3.0.9.    
As this is a sun library we will need to do the usual jumping through hoops.
While we are at it it may be worth upgrading to the latest version of svnkit? Maybe?

fields.description:
When Bamboo kicks off it starts off heaps of threads to check for changes in all the builds to see if its missed any whilst it was down. 

However this can be problematic as it puts a sudden burst of high load on the server. 

Would it be possible to limit this somehow to reduce the load during initial start up.
fields.summary: Have a ramp up process so all builds/change detections are not kicked off simultaneously on Bamboo Start Up.

Plan selector should default to "use favourites"

fields.description: It would be cool if Bamboo could somehow register what time it shut down and on start up check whether and scheduled builds were supposed to occure since then.  One option would then be to kick of these builds, though this could be problematic - they were probably set to run at that time for a reason.  But some form of error notice/notification to let the user know that they haven't been run would be good.
fields.summary: Bamboo should detect whether any scheduled builds were due while its been shut down.

fields.description:
Bamboo is not properly updating all files when detecting changes & running new builds.

This build: http://build.limewire.org/bamboo/build/viewBuildResults.action?buildKey=LW-COMPONENTS&buildNumber=2247 detects the proper changeset and links to it in FishEye ( @ https://www.limewire.org/fisheye/changelog/limecvs/?cs=MAIN:sberlin:20090529225359 ).

That commit should have fixed compilation & caused Bamboo to build properly, but even though Bamboo detected the change (and the files that changed), the files didn't update and the build failed again.  Looking at CVS status for one of those files in Bamboo's build-dir directory shows:

File: FileListAdapter.java      Status: Needs Patch

   Working revision:    1.17
   Repository revision: 1.16    /cvs/private-components/mock-core/src/main/java/org/limewire/core/impl/library/FileListAdapter.java,v
   Commit Identifier:   (none)
   Sticky Tag:          (none)
   Sticky Date:         2009.05.29.09.51.43
   Sticky Options:      -kb


.. which means after the update, the revision on disk is the earlier revision.  Doing a full CVS Status and grepping for "Needs Patch" shows a number of files that need a patch:

File: TorrentDownloadListenerTest.java  Status: Needs Patch
File: AnomalousQueryFilter.java Status: Needs Patch
File: AnomalousQueryFilterTest.java     Status: Needs Patch
File: LibTorrentAlert.java      Status: Needs Patch
File: Torrent.java      Status: Needs Patch
File: libtorrentwrapper.cpp     Status: Needs Patch
File: torrent-wrapper.dll       Status: Needs Patch
File: FileListAdapter.java      Status: Needs Patch
File: FriendFileListAdapter.java        Status: Needs Patch
File: MockLibraryManager.java   Status: Needs Patch
File: LimeWireUiDownloadsTableModule.java       Status: Needs Patch
File: ActiveFilterPanel.java    Status: Needs Patch
File: AdvancedFilterPanel.java  Status: Needs Patch
File: CategoryFilter.java       Status: Needs Patch
File: PropertyFilter.java       Status: Needs Patch
File: SourceFilter.java Status: Needs Patch
File: LimeWireUiLibraryModule.java      Status: Needs Patch
File: LimeWireUiLibrarySharingModule.java       Status: Needs Patch
File: ShareWidgetFactoryImpl.java       Status: Needs Patch
File: SharingActionFactoryImpl.java     Status: Needs Patch
File: StoreMediator.java        Status: Needs Patch
File: StorePanel.java   Status: Needs Patch
File: LimeWireUiSearchModule.java       Status: Needs Patch
File: RemoteHostActionsImpl.java        Status: Needs Patch
File: SponsoredResultsPanel.java        Status: Needs Patch
File: AppFrame.properties       Status: Needs Patch
File: BasicSearchResultsModelTest.java  Status: Needs Patch

The same issue happened on our COMPILE plan.  I manually triggered a build after it failed and no files updated, so the build failed again.  I then changed the plan to force a clean checkout and things worked properly after that.

It looks like Bamboo is just missing updates on a number of files.
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't always update all files (using CVS)
